observationText: Nf1Prx1-/- mice had significantly higher triglyceride content in their muscles compared to wild-type littermates.

Nf1Prx1-/- mice exhibited altered expression of proteins involved in fat metabolism, including higher expression of FAS and leptin, and lower expression of carnitine palmitoyl transferase-1, CD36 and FATP4 compared to wild-type littermates.
Nf1Prx1-/- mice were distinctly smaller than their wild-type littermates, requiring daily saline injections until 4 weeks of age to ensure survival and reduce maternal rejection.
A dietary intervention with a modified chow was able to reduce muscle lipid accumulation and improve muscle function in Nf1Prx1-/- mice.
